title: Inorganic-inorganic composite material and method for producing the same
abstract: Process for producing an inorganic-inorganic composite material, in which an open-pore, crystalline oxide ceramic shaped part is produced from an oxide ceramic powder or a powder of an oxide ceramic mixture after shape-imparting processing and presintering, an infiltration substance is applied to this shaped part in vacuo and at room temperature, and the oxide ceramic is sintered in a densifying manner under an air atmosphere and at ambient pressure to form an inorganic-inorganic composite material.

motivations: There is a need for a method to produce inorganic-inorganic composite materials with improved properties.
objectives: Develop a process for producing an inorganic-inorganic composite material with a crystalline oxide ceramic structure.
methods: Produce an open-pore, crystalline oxide ceramic shaped part through shape-imparting processing and presintering.
Apply an infiltration substance to the shaped part in vacuo and at room temperature.
Sinter the oxide ceramic in a densifying manner under an air atmosphere and at ambient pressure.
results: Create an inorganic-inorganic composite material with enhanced properties.

motivations: There is a need for a reliable method to produce inorganic-inorganic composite materials.
objectives: Develop a process for producing an inorganic-inorganic composite material using an open-pore, crystalline oxide ceramic shaped part.
methods: Shape-imparting processing and presintering of an oxide ceramic powder or a powder of an oxide ceramic mixture to produce a shaped part.
Application of an infiltration substance to the shaped part in vacuo and at room temperature.
Sintering the oxide ceramic in a densifying manner under an air atmosphere and at ambient pressure to form an inorganic-inorganic composite material.
results: Production of an inorganic-inorganic composite material using the proposed method.

motivations: There is a need for advanced composite materials that combine the properties of different inorganic materials to achieve enhanced performance characteristics.
objectives: Develop a process for producing inorganic-inorganic composite materials by combining oxide ceramics with infiltration substances.
methods: Create an open-pore, crystalline oxide ceramic shaped part through shape-imparting processing and presintering.
Apply an infiltration substance to the shaped part under vacuum conditions at room temperature.
Sinter the oxide ceramic under air atmosphere at ambient pressure to achieve densification and form the composite material.
results: Production of inorganic-inorganic composite materials with enhanced properties through the combination of oxide ceramics and infiltration substances.
anthropic_json.research_subject: Production process for inorganic-inorganic composite materials using oxide ceramics
